escjava.plugin
Class EscjavaPlugin

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.core.runtime.Plugin
      org.eclipse.ui.plugin.AbstractUIPlugin
          escjava.plugin.EscjavaPlugin
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.osgi.framework.BundleActivator
public class EscjavaPlugin
extends org.eclipse.ui.plugin.AbstractUIPlugin

The main plugin class for the EscJava plugin.

Author:
David R. Cok

addEscjavaAutocheckNature

public void addEscjavaAutocheckNature(org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject project)
                               throws org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException
This method adds the auto-check nature to the argument project. This is done so that we can have the Escjava checker builder running.

Parameters:
project - The project for which the nature will be set
Throws:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException

removeEscjavaAutocheckNature

public void removeEscjavaAutocheckNature(org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject project)
                                  throws org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException
This removes the auto-check nature from the argument project. This is done so that we can have the Escjava checker stop running.

Parameters:
project - The project from which the Escjava autocheck nature will be removed
Throws:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException

fireEscjavaFailed

public void fireEscjavaFailed(org.eclipse.core.resources.IResource resource,
                              java.lang.String file,
                              int lineNumber,
                              int offset,
                              int length,
                              java.lang.String errorMessage,
                              int severity)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
This method informs the registered listeners that the event 'JML type checking failed' just happened and provides them with descriptive information about the event.

Parameters:
resource - The resource to associate with the failure, if the file is not a resource
file - The file where the event took place
lineNumber - The 1-based line number where the event took place
offset - The 0-based character offset within the file that begins the error location
length - The length in characters of the error location
errorMessage - A message describing the event
severity - The severity of the event (uses severity constants from IEscjavaListener)
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
